hanzi-su-wiki:
養

Значения

Растить, воспитывать; кормить, содержать; развивать, совершенствовать

Мнемоника

Кормить 食 ребёнка бараниной 羊, пока тот не станет большим 大.

Варианты

养
purpleculture_pinyin:
yǎng
to raise (animals); to bring up (children); to keep (pets); to support; to give birth
выращивать (животных); воспитывать (детей); держать (домашних животных); поддерживать; Родить

(Simplified: 养)
Pictophonetic: 羊 indicates the sound; 食 (food) conveys the meaning.

heisig_chinese_memo: For many, food is split into quarters when they are raised - the four food groups.
heisig_constituent: foster, sheep, eat, food, umbrella, good, halo, drop, silver
heisig_story: Sheep . . . food. The key word has the sense of promoting the development of something, especially in a psychological or spiritual sense.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: foster, bring up, rear, develop, nurture
koohiiStory1: A sheep became the foster parent for a wolf pup, feeding it with milk. This story cannot end well...
koohiiStory2: Judy Foster in "The Silence of the Lambs" is what Dr. Hannibal-the cannibal-Lecter would like to eat.
jp_example_words:
扶養(ふよう): support, maintenance
保養(ほよう): health preservation, recuperation, recreation
養う(やしなう): to rear, to maintain, to cultivate
養護(ようご): protection, nursing, protective care
養成(ようせい): training, development
栄養(えいよう): nutrition, nourishment
休養(きゅうよう): rest, break, recreation
教養(きょうよう): culture, education, refinement, cultivation
養分(ようぶん): nourishment, nutrient
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Sheep fins are good for fostering children. The sheep have been genetically combined with fish, so the sheep have fins. These sheep fins are very rich in nutrients and as such are very good for foster children that need to grow up big and strong.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine eating a fish fin with sheep wool on it. It tastes fishy like the ocean but the wool tastes like clothes. It’s probably the worst thing ever. Imagine eating something like this and taste its flavor on your tongue.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The best way to foster a better relationship with these foster kids would be to give them some yogurt (よう). Maybe they can dip the sheep fins in the yogurt to help mask the strange taste. Yogurt is also very nutritious, so it’s a good supplement to the foster kids’ diet.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Remember how bad those sheep fins tasted? Now imagine eating your favorite yogurt flavor instead. You’re a foster child, but you don’t even care about that right now – this yogurt is delicious.
Ru_Meaning: foster, bring up, rear, develop, nurture
Ru_Radicals: 并, 王 (монарх), 羊 (овца), 食 (еда)
Ru_trainchinese: yǎng: (глаг/прил) держать (питомцев), растить; поддерживать; рождать; поправлять здоровье; совершенствовать; приобретать (напр., привычку); отращивать (волосы); приемный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you eat (食) the sheep (𦍌) you've reared
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: For many, food is split into quarters when they are raised - the four food groups.
humanum_full_description_en:
The character form of " raising " was first seen in Xiaozhuan and Qin bamboo slips, starting with " shi " and " yang ". "Said Wen": "𢼝, ancient literature support." " 𢼝 " is also made "卩", from " sheep " to "攴", the font is seen in the Chu bamboo slips of the Warring States period, such as "Guodian Jian. "Six Virtues" Jane 33 "Aspiration for (raising) new (pro)”. " 𢼝 " is a variant of " raising ". After the Qin Dynasty unified the characters, " raising " was used instead of " 𢼝 ".

In the oracle bone inscriptions, there are the characters "䍩" from "羊" from "攴", and the golden characters form from "羊" to " 𠓥 ", which is generally interpreted as a variant of "牧". Shang Chengzuo thinks that the font is the same as the ancient text of "Shuowen", like shepherding sheep with a whip in hand: "For herd, the word is from the cow, and the word for sheep is from the sheep. Later, the word for cattle is used for herd, and the word for raising is 𢼝. . "said a Western Zhou after grazing" animal husbandry "no word writing"䍩"Therefore, bamboo and Warring States" Wen said, "Prose"䍩"just" raise "in Chinese, and a bronze inscription"䍩"word has nothing to do . (Refer to "The Source of Characters")

The original meaning of " raising " is to raise livestock. Such as "Zhou Li. Xia Guan. "King people": "King people, raising horses and raising herds, to serve the masters." "Wu Yue Chun Qiu. "Goujian Entering Minister Wai Zhuan": "Nai Xie Yue has to leave his stone room, go to his palace, and shepherd as usual." The extension means to feed and enable life. "Shuowen": "Support, support." " Support " has a wide range of objects, and different objects mean different meanings.

" Nurturing " can mean the support and support for the elders, parents and elders. Such as "The Analects. "Political": "Today's filial piety means being able to support." "Book of Rites. "Wang Zhi": "Bringing up the elderly to achieve filial piety, showing loneliness to catch the insufficiency." "Historical Records. "The Text of Filial Piety": "It is fortunate to be able to regain support in the Gaomiao in the days of the present. I am not clear and praised, and I am sad and sad!"

" Support " also said that raising, rearing young. Such as "Han Feizi. The Foreign Reserve said upper left": "Man is a baby, and the parents raise Jane, but the child grows up and complains." "Han Shu. "Shihuozhi": "Sent to us privately, hanged to ask illness, and raised orphans and young children in it." It also refers to the monarch supporting the people, such as "Shang Shu. Dayu Mo": "Morality is only good governance, and politics is to support the people." "Zuo Zhuan. "The Fourteenth Year of Xianggong": "A good monarch will reward the good and punish fornication, raise the people like his son, cover like the sky, and tolerate like the earth."

In addition to livestock, other animals can also be raised. Such as "Huainanzi. "The main technique": "For those who raise tigers, leopards, and rhinoceros, the old husband provides a threshold for his cravings, which is suitable for his hunger and fullness, and his anger, but those who cannot end his life will be punished." "Historical Records" . "Fair Standard Book": "He went into slaves and maidservants, divided into various gardens, raised dogs, horses, animals, and other officials."

" Support " can also represent cultivation, planting vegetation. Such as "Pipe. Herdsman: "Those who hide in the inexhaustible mansion raise mulberry and hemp, and raise six animals." "Han Shu. Shihuozhi": "Two thousand stones sent the commander, the three elders, the elders of Litian, and the elders of Litian to receive field tools and learn how to cultivate and raise seedlings."

In addition to specific people or things, the object of " raising " can also be abstract things, which means cultivation and encouragement. Such as "Mencius. Do your heart’s care": "Keep your heart and nurture your nature, so it’s a matter of heaven." "Zhuangzi. "Dasheng": "A good health-preserving person, if shepherds the sheep, he will whip them according to the latter." "Mawangdui Han Tomb Silk Book." "Ming Jun" line 40: "However, if you have fun, no one will win."

" Nurturing " can be used as a noun to mean the things to be supported and the needs of life. Such as "Xunzi. "Tian Theory": "Strengthen the foundation and save the use, then the sky cannot be poor, and when it is nourished, the sky cannot be sick."

The meaning of parenting can be extended to mean childbirth. "Jade articles. Food Department: "Nurturing, nurturing." Such as "Book of Rites. "University": "I haven't learned to adopt children, but the latter is also." Also refers to breastfeeding, such as "Xunzi. "Ritual Theory": "The father can give birth, but he cannot raise it." Yang Di's note: "It is also a breastfeeding."

" Nurturing " also means education and nurturing. Such as "Book of Rites. Wen Wang Shi Zi": "Establish a big fu, young fu to support them, want them to know the way of father and son, monarch and minister." "Mencius. Li Lou Xia": "You can't raise middle and talents, so people are happy to have good fathers and brothers." Zhu Xi's collection of notes: "Nurturing means nurturing and nurturing, and it is self-contained."

" Yang " is a generic term for ancient Yizu. Such as "Historical Records. "The Book of the First Emperor of Qin": "Although the guards were raised, I don't think about it here." Sima Zhensuo Yin: "Raise, that is, death." Also specifically refers to the husband. Such as "The Spring and Autumn Rampage. Xuangong Twelve Years": "Hundreds of dead were supported by the servants." He Xiu's note: "The one who cooks the dead is called to raise." "Han Shu. "Gongsun Hongbu Shier Kuan Biography": "Poor and useless, try to support all the disciples." He Xiu's note: "Raise, the Lord will give the cook."
humanum_short_description_en: From " food " to " sheep " sound. The original meaning is to raise livestock.
humanum_full_description:
「養」的字形最早見於小篆和秦簡，從「食」，「羊」聲。《說文》：「𢼝，古文養。」「𢼝」又作「䍩」，從「羊」從「攴」，字形見於戰國楚簡，如《郭店簡．六德》簡33「求𢼝（養）新（親）之志」。「𢼝」是「養」的異體，秦代統一文字後多用「養」而不用「𢼝」。

　　甲骨文中有從「羊」從「攴」的「䍩」字，金文字形從「羊」從「𠓥」，一般釋為「牧」的異體。商承祚以為字形與《說文》古文同，象以手持鞭而牧羊：「牧牛則字從牛，𢼝羊則字從羊也。後以從牛之字為牧，而以𢼝為養矣。」一說西周以後放牧的「牧」字未見寫作「䍩」，因此，戰國竹簡和《說文》古文的「䍩」只是「養」的異體，和甲金文的「䍩」字無關。（參《字源》）

　　「養」的本義是牧養牲畜。如《周禮．夏官．圉人》：「圉人，掌養馬芻牧之事，以役圉師。」《吳越春秋．勾踐入臣外傳》：「乃赦越王得離其石室，去就其宮室，執牧養之事如故。」引申表示養活、使能生活下去。《說文》：「養，供養也。」「養」的對象很廣泛，對象不同也表示不同的詞義。

　　「養」可以表示對在上者、父母長輩的供養、奉養。如《論語．為政》：「今之孝者，是謂能養。」《禮記．王制》：「養耆老以致孝，恤孤獨以逮不足。」《史記．孝文本紀》：「今乃幸以天年，得復供養于高廟，朕之不明與嘉之，其奚哀悲之有！」

　　「養」也表示撫養、養育幼小。如《韓非子．外儲說左上》：「人為嬰兒也，父母養之簡，子長而怨。」《漢書．食貨志》：「又私自送往迎來，弔死問疾，養孤長幼在其中。」亦指君主扶養百姓，如《尚書．大禹謨》：「德惟善政，政在養民。」《左傳．襄公十四年》：「良君將賞善而刑淫，養民如子，蓋之如天，容之如地。」

　　除了牲畜外，還可以飼養其他動物。如《淮南子．主術》：「故夫養虎豹犀象者，為之圈檻，供其嗜欲，適其飢飽，達其怒恚，然而不能終其天年者，刑有所劫也。」《史記．平準書》：「其沒入奴婢，分諸苑養狗馬禽獸，及與諸官。」

　　「養」還可以表示培植、種植草木。如《管子．牧民》：「藏於不竭之府者，養桑麻、育六畜也。」《漢書．食貨志》：「二千石遣令長、三老、力田及里父老善田者受田器，學耕種養苗狀。」

　　除了具體的人或物，「養」的對象也可以是抽象的事物，表示培養、助長。如《孟子．盡心上》：「存其心，養其性，所以事天也。」《莊子．達生》：「善養生者，若牧羊然，視其後者而鞭之。」《馬王堆漢墓帛書．明君》第40行：：「然則養耳目之樂，莫若必勝。」

　　「養」作名詞可表示供養之物、生活所需。如《荀子．天論》：「彊本而節用，則天不能貧，養備而動時，則天不能病。」

　　由撫養義可引申表示生育。《玉篇．食部》：「養，育也。」如《禮記．大學》：「未有學養子而後者也。」又指哺乳，如《荀子．禮論》：「父能生之，不能養之。」楊倞注：「謂哺乳之也。」

　　「養」還表示教育、熏陶。如《禮記．文王世子》：「立大傅、少傅以養之，欲其知父子君臣之道也。」《孟子．離婁下》：「中也養不中，才也養不才，故人樂有賢父兄也。」朱熹集注：「養謂涵育熏陶，俟其自化也。」

　　「養」是古代役卒的通稱。如《史記．秦始皇本紀》：「雖監門之養，不觳於此。」司馬貞索隱：「養，即卒也。」又特指伙夫。如《春秋公羊傳．宣公十二年》：「廝役扈養死者數百人。」何休注：「炊亨者曰養。」《漢書．公孫弘卜式兒寬傳》：「貧無資用，嘗為弟子都養。」何休注：「養，主給烹炊者也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「食」，「羊」聲。本義是牧養牲畜。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
養 (Simplified: 养)
Pinyin: yǎng
English Definition: to raise (animals); to bring up (children); to keep (pets); to support; to give birth
Total strokes: 15; Radical: 食
Pictophonetic: 羊 indicates the sound; 食 (food) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 羊 [ yáng ] sheep, goat
    • 食 [ shí ] food; to eat
Example Words:
養殖 [ yǎng zhí ]: to cultivate; cultivation; to further; to encourage
養老 [ yǎng lǎo ]: to provide for the elderly (family members); to enjoy a life in retirement
More: 養* | *養 | *養*

Compound 養 from (rem- 介 jiè) from mouth-eating 食 shí and related phonetic sheep 羊 yáng A284 养[養] new-char 养. (name- feed (养)養 yǎng)

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
(- to give food 食 to a sheep 羊)

Simplification rule : A284 养[養]

Simplification rule explained :
new-char cursive(丿丨) 养 (to raise an animal) 養 (to raise an animal)

Variant rule : C000

①撫育，供給生活品：養育。贍養。撫養。養家。
②飼養動物，培植花草：養花。養殖。
③生育，生小孩兒。
④撫養的(非親生的)：養子。養父。養母。
⑤教育，訓練：培養。教養。
⑥使身心得到滋補和休息：養病。養心。養性。休養。營養。養精蓄銳。
⑦保護修補：養路。

「 養 」的字形最早見於小篆和秦簡，從「 食 」，「 羊 」聲。《說文》：「𢼝，古文養。」「 𢼝 」又作「 䍩 」，從「 羊 」從「 攴 」，字形見於戰國楚簡，如《郭店簡．六德》簡33「求𢼝（養）新（親）之志」。「 𢼝 」是「 養 」的異體，秦代統一文字後多用「 養 」而不用「 𢼝 」。 甲骨文中有從「 羊 」從「 攴 」的「 䍩 」字，金文字形從「 羊 」從「 𠓥 」，一般釋為「 牧 」的異體。商承祚以為字形與《說文》古文同，象以手持鞭而牧羊：「牧牛則字從牛，𢼝羊則字從羊也。後以從牛之字為牧，而以𢼝為養矣。」一說西周以後放牧的「 牧 」字未見寫作「 䍩 」，因此，戰國竹簡和《說文》古文的「 䍩 」只是「 養 」的異體，和甲金文的「 䍩 」字無關。（參《字源》） 「 養 」的本義是牧養牲畜。如《周禮．夏官．圉人》：「圉人，掌養馬芻牧之事，以役圉師。」《吳越春秋．勾踐入臣外傳》：「乃赦越王得離其石室，去就其宮室，執牧養之事如故。」引申表示養活、使能生活下去。《說文》：「養，供養也。」「 養 」的對象很廣泛，對象不同也表示不同的詞義。 「 養 」可以表示對在上者、父母長輩的供養、奉養。如《論語．為政》：「今之孝者，是謂能養。」《禮記．王制》：「養耆老以致孝，恤孤獨以逮不足。」《史記．孝文本紀》：「今乃幸以天年，得復供養于高廟，朕之不明與嘉之，其奚哀悲之有！」 「 養 」也表示撫養、養育幼小。如《韓非子．外儲說左上》：「人為嬰兒也，父母養之簡，子長而怨。」《漢書．食貨志》：「又私自送往迎來，弔死問疾，養孤長幼在其中。」亦指君主扶養百姓，如《尚書．大禹謨》：「德惟善政，政在養民。」《左傳．襄公十四年》：「良君將賞善而刑淫，養民如子，蓋之如天，容之如地。」 除了牲畜外，還可以飼養其他動物。如《淮南子．主術》：「故夫養虎豹犀象者，為之圈檻，供其嗜欲，適其飢飽，達其怒恚，然而不能終其天年者，刑有所劫也。」《史記．平準書》：「其沒入奴婢，分諸苑養狗馬禽獸，及與諸官。」 「 養 」還可以表示培植、種植草木。如《管子．牧民》：「藏於不竭之府者，養桑麻、育六畜也。」《漢書．食貨志》：「二千石遣令長、三老、力田及里父老善田者受田器，學耕種養苗狀。」 除了具體的人或物，「 養 」的對象也可以是抽象的事物，表示培養、助長。如《孟子．盡心上》：「存其心，養其性，所以事天也。」《莊子．達生》：「善養生者，若牧羊然，視其後者而鞭之。」《馬王堆漢墓帛書．明君》第40行：：「然則養耳目之樂，莫若必勝。」 「 養 」作名詞可表示供養之物、生活所需。如《荀子．天論》：「彊本而節用，則天不能貧，養備而動時，則天不能病。」 由撫養義可引申表示生育。《玉篇．食部》：「養，育也。」如《禮記．大學》：「未有學養子而後者也。」又指哺乳，如《荀子．禮論》：「父能生之，不能養之。」楊倞注：「謂哺乳之也。」 「 養 」還表示教育、熏陶。如《禮記．文王世子》：「立大傅、少傅以養之，欲其知父子君臣之道也。」《孟子．離婁下》：「中也養不中，才也養不才，故人樂有賢父兄也。」朱熹集注：「養謂涵育熏陶，俟其自化也。」 「 養 」是古代役卒的通稱。如《史記．秦始皇本紀》：「雖監門之養，不觳於此。」司馬貞索隱：「養，即卒也。」又特指伙夫。如《春秋公羊傳．宣公十二年》：「廝役扈養死者數百人。」何休注：「炊亨者曰養。」《漢書．公孫弘卜式兒寬傳》：「貧無資用，嘗為弟子都養。」何休注：「養，主給烹炊者也。」

yàng, yǎng
вм. 养
Radicals: 羊, 良, ハ  (sheep, good, fins)
Meaning Mnemonic
Sheep fins are good for fostering children. The sheep have been genetically combined with fish, so the sheep have fins. These sheep fins are very rich in nutrients and as such are very good for foster children that need to grow up big and strong.
Imagine eating a fish fin with sheep wool on it. It tastes fishy like the ocean but the wool tastes like clothes. It’s probably the worst thing ever. Imagine eating something like this and taste its flavor on your tongue.
Reading Mnemonic
The best way to foster a better relationship with these foster kids would be to give them some yogurt (よう). Maybe they can dip the sheep fins in the yogurt to help mask the strange taste. Yogurt is also very nutritious, so it’s a good supplement to the foster kids’ diet.
Remember how bad those sheep fins tasted? Now imagine eating your favorite yogurt flavor instead. You’re a foster child, but you don’t even care about that right now – this yogurt is delicious.
